result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas R. FAGAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics (Fentanyl) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • PTC Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics (Fentanyl) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 2 only.
Fifty (50) hours of community service for each year while on probation.  The Court suggests that community service be directed at drug awareness.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.
Letter to DOC

On 08-17-15, the Court suspended the conditional jail time so the defendant could receive medical treatment.
The Court held a brief conference with counsel and it was determined that the defendant should return to the jail following today's hearing.  There is a room available for the defendant and the nurse shall be allowed medical records.  Defense counsel requests the court allow electronic monitoring.  The Court may reconsider after the defendant's 09-08-15 doctor's appointment.  The defendant is granted a medical furlough to attend that 09-08-15 appointmend.
Minutes.

1) Letter to Judge Fox from Atty. Barbara J. Kirchner.
2) Letter to Judge Fox from Atty. Barbara J. Kirchner.
Status conference set for 09-04-15 at 10:00 a.m.

It is hereby ordered:
1.  That Thomas Fagan's conditional jail time be suspended commencing 08-17-15.
2.  That Thomas Fagan be released from the Manitowoc County Jail on 08-17-15, to address his medical health needs.
3.  That Thomas Fagan's conditional jail time is suspended until his status hearing on 09-04-15 at 10:00 a.m. at which time the Court will revisit Mr. Fagan's case and address the remaining condition jail time.
Fax cover sheet.
Fax confirmation sheet.

Motion hearing set for 08-17-15 at 9:00 a.m.

for Sentence Credit.

The Court hereby orders that the JOC be amended to reflect the sentence credit set forth in the Stipulation attached.

for records from WI DOJ.

State files an Amended Information charging 1 ct. PTC First Degree Reckless Homicide, contrary to Section 940.02(2)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes and 2 cts. PTC Deliver Schedule I or II Narcotics (Fentanyl), contrary to Section 961.41(1)(a) & 939.05 of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
Count 2 - PTC Deliver Schedule I or II Narcotic (Fentanyl) - No contest plea.  
Count 3 - PTC Deliver Schedule I or II Narcotic (Fentanyl) - No contest plea.  Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in count 1, PTC 1st degree reckless homicide.  Motion granted.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation rpeort to be completed by DOC.  Sentencing hearing is set for 04-20-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Report to be filed by 04-13-15.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Minutes.

The defense has submitted pathology reports to the State.  The State needs time for their expert to review these.
Status conference is set for 12-11-14 at 3:30 p.m.
Plea date is reset to 02-11-15 at 11:30 a.m.

Joint preliminary hearing held with State vs. David Radandt, Case No. 14 CF 279.  Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Arraignment is set for 07-30-14 at 3:00 p.m.  
Minutes

Invocation of Right to Counsel.
Cover letter.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 07-18-14 at 2:30 p.m.

Subpoena issued.  RE:  Walgreens, Records Department, Two Rivers, WI.
Affidavit of Detective Erik Kowalski, Manitowoc City Police Department.
Return of Officer.
Re:  Christopher T. Vogel, on 05-08-14.

Defendant in custody.  
The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with PTC 1st Degree Reckless Homicide-Deliver Drugs.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-30-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $6,000.00 cash with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with David Radandt and Tyler Reed and defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department daily by 6:00 p.m.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
